comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: The officer at the front was the Bandmaster. When on the march his position is taken by the Drum Major and the Bandmaster marched within the ranks. The tunics of the bandsmen had gold braid across the chest, cuffs and skirt (rear) until WWII, then the braid dissappeared from the bandsmen's tunics, except for the Drum Major who still has the gold braided tunic.

comment.author: 87069596@N02
comment._content: Guards Bands did not have a Bandmaster in those days, the officer is officially termed Director of Music. These days the Guards Bands have a Bandmaster (WO1 rank) who is 2nd in command, plus a Director of Music, usually a Major, or in the case of the Senior Director of Music, Guards Division, Lt. Colonel.
